issue.title: [CF 613] Starts game with iconview.lua error
issue.body:
I have tried downloading tmw from different sites and different version currently using 6.0.3 from curse gaming, but no version has ever worked for me even from a month ago so anyways right when I log in it tell me to exit wow caue of a iconview.lua problem and restart wow I do and I get same message so I cancel it and try to /tmw only problem is that it command wont go through after hitting enter so I went into interface/addons in game and hit addons and clicked tmw then it shows on my chat window that its loading options but nothing shows up so this is the error that I copied

Also just tried the 6.0.4 version and still same message

> Posted by CurseForge user Mantone | Imported from CurseForge issue #613 | Raw

comments.body:
I'm absolutely at a loss as to why this might be happening. Could you please download and install http://www.curse.com/addons/wow/bugsack and http://www.curse.com/addons/wow/bug-grabber (both are needed), and post all of the errors that you get from BugSack? BugSack's error reports are a bit more informative than Blizzard's, which is why I need you to install these two addons.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

A few questions:

  • How do you install TMW? Do you use the curse client, or do you download the .zip and extract it into your addons folder?
  • Could you verify for me that IconView.lua is located in Interface/AddOns/TellMeWhen/Components/Core/IconView.lua
  • Could you type '/dump TMW.baseName' in-game and tell me what it spits out in your chat frame?
Edited Sep 13, 2012

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

@Cybeloras: Go

Ok I got both bug checkers and I still get the message and bug sacker says I have none I download the zip from curse and cut and paste and yes the lua is right where you told me to look . Also did the /dump and its said 1= TellMeWhen

Edited Sep 13, 2012

> Posted by CurseForge user Mantone

OK. I think I might know where the problem is now. Could you go into World Of Warcraft/Logs and attach the FrameXML.log file to your ticket?

Make sure to exit WoW before you do.

The attach button for tickets is at the top-right side of this page.

Edited Sep 14, 2012

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Closing ticket, as it has gone over a month now with no response to my request for more information.

Please respond if this is still an issue for you.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Hi, I sent you the requested informations.

I deal with the same problem as Mantone.

That's what I got of the FrameXML

10/18 13:34:17.238 Loading table of contents Interface\FrameXML\FrameXML.toc 10/18 13:34:17.238 Loading file Interface\FrameXML\QuestLogFrame.xml 10/18 13:34:17.238 QuestLogDetailInset: Couldn't find relative frame: QuestLogFrame 10/18 13:34:17.238 QuestLogDetailInset: Couldn't find relative frame: QuestLogFrame 10/18 13:34:17.238 Loading add-on Blizzard_PetBattleUI 10/18 13:34:17.238 Loading table of contents Interface\AddOns\Blizzard_PetBattleUI\Blizzard_PetBattleUI.toc 10/18 13:34:17.238 Loading file Interface\AddOns\Blizzard_PetBattleUI\Blizzard_PetBattleUI.xml 10/18 13:34:17.238 Frame PetBattlePrimaryUnitTooltip: Unknown script element OnClick 10/18 13:34:17.238 Loading add-on TellMeWhen 10/18 13:34:17.238 Loading table of contents Interface\AddOns\TellMeWhen\TellMeWhen.toc 10/18 13:34:17.238 Loading file Interface\AddOns\TellMeWhen\Components\includes.core.xml 10/18 13:34:17.238 Error loading Interface\AddOns\TellMeWhen\Components\Conditions.lua 10/18 13:34:17.238 Couldn't open Interface\AddOns\TellMeWhen\Components\Categories\includes.core.xml 10/18 13:34:17.238 Loading add-on Titan 10/18 13:34:17.238 Loading table of contents Interface\AddOns\Titan\Titan.toc 10/18 13:34:17.238 Error loading Interface\AddOns\Titan\locale\Locatization.KR.lua


> Posted by CurseForge user Slennos

What OS do you play WoW in? OSX or Windows? Or Linux with Wine?

The problem is, in case you were wondering, is that the files defined in the includes.xml files aren't being loaded from the correct paths. It gets to loading Conditions, and tries to open "Interface\AddOns\TellMeWhen\Components\Categories\includes.core.xml", but the correct location for this file is "Interface\AddOns\TellMeWhen\Components\Conditions\Categories\includes.core.xml". When it gets to this missing file, instead of skipping past it, the entire loading process halts immediately, leaving you with a mostly incomplete addon (thus the IconView.lua missing error)

Edited Oct 18, 2012

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

I'm using Windows Home 64Bit.

WoW is running on C:\Program Files (x86)\World of Warcraft

And to confirm your statement. As you mentioned, there's no Conditions File.

Edited Oct 19, 2012

> Posted by CurseForge user Slennos

Hmmm, now I'm really confused.

Have you tried deleting TellMeWhen and TellMeWhen_Options out of your Interface\Addons folder and then reinstalling them? It could be that for some reason, some old files from previous versions are interfering.

Edited Oct 19, 2012

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

I tried it several times reinstalling it.

It was the first time I installed it since I downloaded WoW completly after deleting it. So I don't think that different versions are interfereing.

I noticed something the first time I installed it: while the installing process , i was asked if I want to save & keep the file / save and delete the previous file / keep the old file and skip the new one.

Unfortunatetly I can't remember which file it was.


> Posted by CurseForge user Slennos

Do you install your addons using the Curse Client? Or do you manually unzip them? If so, what program to you use the unzip them?


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

I'm sorry. I completely forgot to check for an answer...

I haven't used the Curse Client yet but I'll try it in the near future.

Usually I do the following steps. I enter the folder and cut the files in it. I then insert them into the Addon folder. That's all I do. I don't delete the zipfolders until I download a new version.


> Posted by CurseForge user Slennos

Are you still having this problem? You mentioned that you would give the Curse Client a try, but I haven't heard back from you on whether or not it fixed the problem for you or not (which is my fault for not actually asking you this sooner, so I apologize).


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Another user has just reported this problem (http://wow.curseforge.com/addons/tellmewhen/tickets/719-tell-me-when-error/), and after working with him for a bit, we discovered that installing through the Curse Client seems to have fixed the issue.

If this doesn't fix it for you, though, then please let me know and I will work with you to try and figure out how to fix the problem for good.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras
